trustfund:
TF036798-PHILIPPINES - RURAL FINANCE III,TF037064-PHILIPPINE - RURAL FINANCE III,
            ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT,TF037807-PHILIPPINES - AGRICULTURE
            SECTOR FOR ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Rural Finance Project for the
            Philippines had a satisfactory outcome and a moderate risk
            to development outcome.  The Bank performance was
            satisfactory, while the borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory.  The main lessons include: A) A
            government-owned bank within a generally sound enabling
            environment can reach out effectively and efficiently to
            rural areas through wholesale operations when other private
            players are reluctant to take risks in a challenging sector
            or at a challenging economic time. B) It is important in a
            rural finance project involving a government owned bank, to
            analyze explicit and implicit subsidies for both the
            institution and the sector to ascertain the levelness of the
            playing field for non-government entrants. C) When poverty
            alleviation is stated as a micro-finance objective it is
            difficult to assess achievement without some form of
            beneficiary impact assessment. D) There is a need for better
            coordination between the Bank and IFC and resolution of
            disputed areas of turf before project preparation work.
